citation.abstract: Healthy life expectancy (HALE) summarises mortality and non-fatal outcomes in a single measure of average population health. It has been used to compare health between countries, or to measure changes over time. These comparisons can inform policy questions that depend on how morbidity changes as mortality decreases. We characterise current HALE and changes over the past two decades in 187 countries.
citation.title: Healthy life expectancy for 187 countries, 1990-2010: a systematic analysis for the Global Burden Disease Study 2010.

医療従事者のますますの活躍が期待されますね！

またexpantion of morbidity仮説（医学的介入により疾患を原因とする死亡率は低下するが、疾患の発生率は低下せず、その結果として有病率は上昇する）と一致する知見もあり、健康寿命の延長をどうやったらできるかも考えなければならないところですね。

wikipedia.title: Structural violence in Haiti
wikipedia.summary: As defined by Medical Anthropologist Dr. Paul Farmer, structural violence is the way by which social arrangements are constructed to put specific members of a population in harm's way.
